rev.comment: rm censorship & privacy issues. this information is covered verbatim in the [[History of Google]] article. redundant.

Line 46: Line 46:
After the company's IPO in [[August]] [[2004]], it was reported that Founders [[Sergey Brin]] and [[Larry Page]], as well as CEO [[Eric Schmidt]], have accepted a base salary of [[United States Dollar|$]]1.00. They have all declined recent offers of bonuses and increases in compensation by Google's board of directors. In a [[2006]] report of the world's richest people, [[Forbes]] reported that [[Sergey Brin]] was #26 with a net worth of [[United States Dollar|$]]12.9 Billion, and [[Larry Page]] was #27 with a net worth of [[United States Dollar|$]]12.8 Billion.<ref>Kroll, Luisa; Fass, Allison. "[http://www.forbes.com/home/lists/2006/03/07/06billionaires_worlds-richest-people_land.html The World's Billionaires]." ''[[Forbes]].'' [[March 9]], [[2006]].</ref>
After the company's IPO in [[August]] [[2004]], it was reported that Founders [[Sergey Brin]] and [[Larry Page]], as well as CEO [[Eric Schmidt]], have accepted a base salary of [[United States Dollar|$]]1.00. They have all declined recent offers of bonuses and increases in compensation by Google's board of directors. In a [[2006]] report of the world's richest people, [[Forbes]] reported that [[Sergey Brin]] was #26 with a net worth of [[United States Dollar|$]]12.9 Billion, and [[Larry Page]] was #27 with a net worth of [[United States Dollar|$]]12.8 Billion.<ref>Kroll, Luisa; Fass, Allison. "[http://www.forbes.com/home/lists/2006/03/07/06billionaires_worlds-richest-people_land.html The World's Billionaires]." ''[[Forbes]].'' [[March 9]], [[2006]].</ref>
â   â
==Google and privacy issues==
  â
{{main|Google and privacy issues}}
  â
As the world's biggest search and ad-broker company, [[Google]] has drawn its share of criticism and concern about the privacy of its users. Its privacy policy was revised on [[October 14]] [[2005]]. Additionally, privacy info about various Google services was made also available.
  â   â
==Google and censorship issues==
  â   â
Google, along with Yahoo! and MSN, participates in [[China]]'s [[internet censorship]] program, commonly referred to as the [[Great Firewall of China]]. The Chinese version of Google, www.google.cn, limits search results on such topics as the [[Tiananmen Square protests of 1989|Tiananmen Square Incident]], and other topics considered off-limits by Chinese authorities. See [[History of Google]] for for more information regarding this controversy.
